_header: By a forest side walking as I went
Note: For another version see 5909; cf. also 4344.
Title(s): ‘A tretyse of Parce michi domine’; The Bird with Four Feathers
Subjects: allegories; dream visions; birds, as speakers/narrators; transitoriness, of life
_description: ‘A tretyse of Parce michi domine’, Allegory of the bird with four feathers — 240 lines in 8-, l2-, up to 20-line stanzas, with this refrain

Bod596.First Lines:
By a forest syde walking as I wentDisport to take In o
                    mornyng…
Bod596.Last Lines:
…And Parce geteth godis pyteAnd scheweth to vs his blesses
                    face
Bod596.Attributed Title:
Here bygynnith the tretys of Parce michi domine (f.
                    21v)
Bod596.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 208-15.
Fein,  Susanna Greer. 
             Moral Love Songs and Laments.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1998.

BodDou322.First Lines:
By a forest syde walkyng as I wentDisporte to take in o
                    mornyng…
BodDou322.Last Lines:
…And parce geteth goddys pyteAnd sheweth to vs hys
                    blessed face
BodDou322.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth A tretyse of Parce michi domine (f.
                    15rb)
BodDou322.Editions:
Kail,  J.,
                        ed.  
             Twenty-Six Political and Other Poems…from Bodleian MSS Digby 102

EETS

BodLatMisE85.First Lines:
In a forest [ ] I we[ ][ ]rt to take in a morny[ ]ye fond a
                    place with bowys [ ]ent…
BodLatMisE85.Last Lines:
…My thyrd fether strengeþe hyt hytheParce mihi
                        domineMy name was knowyn no ulk a syde…
BodLatMisE85.Note:
9 stanzas; first 9 lines copied again by the same hand on f.
                        82v.

CamTCC601.First Lines:
By a forest side walkyng as I wentDisport to take in o
                    mornyngA place I fond shadid with boughis bentI sette aboute with
                    flowris swete smellyng…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…And Parce getith goddis piteAnd shewith to vs his
                    blissed face
CamTCC601.Attributed Title: Here bigynnyth a treatise of Parce michi domine (f. 34)

CamTCC1450.First Lines:
By a foreste syde walkynge as y wentDysporte to take yn a
                    mornyng…
CamTCC1450.Last Lines:
…God grawnte vs all to se thy blessyd faceThat seyth Parce
                        michi domine

BLHar1706.First Lines: By a forest syde walkynge as I wenteDysporte to take in o mornyng…
BLHar1706.Last Lines: …And Parce geteth goddys pyteAnd sheweth to vs hys blessed face
BLHar1706.Attributed Title: Here begynneth of Parce michi domine a tretyse (f. 15vb)

BLRoy18Ax.First Lines:
By a forest syde walkyng as I wentDesport to take in a
                    mornynge…
BLRoy18Ax.Last Lines:
…And seyde hiȝe gode in magesteI þanke þe of
                    þi sondeParce michi domine

HunHM906.Transcription:
Be on fayre forest syde And by the wase wandrying os that I
                    wentmy sportes be for to take thus in a may mornyngffor and I fond a
                    place of gentyll bowris gay…
HunHM906.Note:
Prozaicized version of lines 1-3, among pentrials in a book of Statutes;
                    written as prose.
HunHM906.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 241.
